Homage to MADAME
Companion of my life, you are in same time my mother, my sister and my grandmother,
Also being these heiresses: my daughters and my grand daughters ...
Sometimes you behave like the head of the company
So you turn protective like a big brother, grandpa or daddy

Even cuddly like our sons and their children
With you, I feel surrounded by all the members of our coven
You are both my aunt my uncle and all my kinsmen,
In you, I find mountains, hills,lakes and oceans ...

Representing a lush green meadow , a surface of peaceful water ,
Your presence gives us such restful breathers
Your approving looks come to warm my days in move
Your voice so sweet bring me oh how many signs of love!

Although escape imperceptibly from time to time a few shrill intonations
In you is consumed as at the bottom of a volcano a fire of ardent passion:
With incessant desires to transmute this world where there is so much injustice and miseries,
By dreaming of great prospects for progress in a nice world of harmony ...

Tireless caregiver of small and big ailments for humanity
You assume all the positions and all the trades of our society
Being a teacher, writer, scientist ,craftswoman, shopkeeper, peasant, athlete or a liberal profession
The woman gives everything of her person without counting in an optimal mention

For her, there is only a search for small pleasures, however
A tidy house, surrounded by a beautiful garden full of flowers
A husband, kids, and all healthy relatives, Let everyone behave with her in a decent, considerate manner and positive

Every day, she puts all her affection into the preparation of some delicious dishes . Happy to see her family come together on feast days to cherish...
A simple life, a holy, healthy, serene and peaceful life
With great hope that anything is all right

My Lady is a true Queen without a crown band
Carrying our home and the entire Globe in her good hands
This Majesty well deserves the Nobel Prize for Intrinsic Nobility
The permanent Golden Oscar for the female star of all our film libraries

Without her, without this source of life we â€‹â€‹wouldn't exist
A deep gratitude to the Woman and to all our lovely spouses and feminists
Above all, these lines poetically testify all my sincere praises to Madame .
In my mother tongue, we say phonetically with a lot of consideration: thank you "BÃ  Äáº§m, all BÃ  Äáº§mâ€.

So for me today is day 3 of the Renew calendar and I woke up late. I was starving, so I had breakfast (tamales to be exact). I didn't feel able to go through the 36 minute session with downward facing dogs and vinyasa, and although I felt like cheating all along, I chose this lovely, magnificent, gentle 22 minute session. Love your videos Adriene! The only thing that is constantly a struggle is all the talking while trying to focus through the posture and either clear my mind or just let it be. It distracts my focus or makes my thoughts race more when someone else repeats it over and over to let them go. I also notice that sometimes there's a lot of talking. For example, we're on the right side then take 5 breaths, then on the other side it will really by 5 breathes when 16 were put in on the other side. I'll have to pause the videos a lot and even out which makes these sessions take up more time than I was ready to commit for. I also wish there was some way you could let the videos run for at least 3 minutes in silence at the end to allow the final pose to have its true effect. If I have to get up and pause it, then I lose it my interest in actually doing the final pose and turn it off usually. Thank you for sharing your videos on your channel!

Adriene, your pre and post cardio stretch videos, have, in the past, been instrumental in helping me both FEEL great/build muscle/diminish brain fog/increase energy AND avoid painful nocturnal leg cramps. The stretching, I have proven to myself, aids in my experiencing less back pain/weight-bearing/nerve pain during my cardio, HiiT and walks. Much thanks for that.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             I,  however,  changed up my exercise regime & consequently replaced the daily routine of 50 mins of cardio, concentrating instead upon upon walking and strength training (neglecting your videos and the stretching in the process) and my nocturnal leg cramps have once again become a horrific challenge which frequently interrupt my sleep. Thus far, the nocturnal cramping  has not been avoided with much hydration / the application of topical magnesium chloride flakes in solution / supplements / the topical application of cider vinegar  (which once worked immediately and effectively to instantly un-cramp the muscle in the past), NOR has the ingestion of cider vinegar helped in any noticeable way.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             TODAY I did a brief stint of cardio upon awakening (as recommended as an to aid to improving my  sleep quality) and  book-ended the cardio with those two videos (which preface and follow my 160BPM music selection(s))  and I FEEL better than I have in AGES. AGAIN, thanks. I am really focusing on my sleep quality now as so much research stresses the importance of this facet of our daily life as being vital for repair of brain tissue, muscle and for weight loss/weight gain/emotional well being, and health..among other benefits.  Recent sleep research recommends STRETCHING before bed: both to improve the QUALITY of one's sleep and to avoid those pesky cramps which JOLT me out of sleep. When I stretch WITHOUT your guidance, the process itself is both BORING and not....as relaxing nor beneficial as when i stretch WITH  your instructions....so I ask you, please, WHICH existing video would you suggest as a pre bedtime ritual to aid in improving sleep quality and reducing, perhaps, the severity or frequency of those pesky nocturnal leg (thigh, glute, calf and foot) cramps? ADDITIONALLY, I ask that you, PLEASE, Adriene, consider creating yet another video(s) with the specific yoga YOU FEEL would help we, your legion of HAPPIER, HEALTHIER  novitiates (and those further along the path) which we might  add to our nightly routine to aid with increasing our  sleep quality ? Thank you, should you have the time to respond to this, (or create such content) and thanks, regardless,  for the increased HEALTH and well-being AND MOBILITY I have gained from your tutelage. Hi Adriene! I love your videos, I've been doing my classes for years and I'm old at Yoga. Today, however, I had a question. I realize that you are super elongated and can get your foot and so on, but in the Butterfly posture, the Baddha Konasana, your legs do not touch the floor. I know stretching is different in each body part for each person, but as it is very easy for me to make the Butterfly and my legs fully touch the floor and yet my chest and my face touch the floor, I'm wondering if you really don't have this stretch or did not want to demonstrate in the video not to impress your subscribers ?! It remains to be said that I have been practicing for over 14 years and have already taken a course to be a Yoga Instructor, but I did not conclude because I am dedicating myself to another career. Adriene, I have been following you and your videos for several years now. You and your videos are the reason I dove so deep into my at-home practice. Being a person who never really liked practicing in group settings I found your channel to be the perfect outlet for self-care and finding what feels good, and yoga soon became part of my daily routine as a result.


Shortly after new years eve this year I was in a pretty bad car accident that left me with a tremendously painful neck injury and a bleak outlook on what the future would hold for me as far as being physically active. After many months of physical therapy and massage, I have just now gained the comfort and confidence to jump back into my practice -- this video being my first step.


Thank you for continuing to do what you do for all these years, and for giving me a home to come back to after 7 months of being out of practice. I am no where near the level I once was, but I have never felt more hopeful than I did after this session today. Looking forward to continuing to rebuild my practice with you. Feeling nothing but gratitude.


Namaste to you and the entire YWA family across the world.

... while You have us focused on Find What Feels Good and that wherever we're at is already 'being there', 'being good enough/perfect', and - surprise! - the yoga poses are better than ever, as a side-effect, AND you help transform the inner narrative in millions of people around the globe. It helps ground and (re)align us with our Love-filled Spirit. Adriene, Benji, and Chris, You're three of the leading peacemakers of this time, just by being who you are and doing what you love, co-creating in that - and sharing it with us. For the whole winter I did yoga every day. I was in a bit of a slump in November and from December through March I maybe missed four days. I started with one of your 30 day challenges having done a fair amount of yoga but not a daily practice. I felt AMAZING! I had so much love and joy and graceful movement. This past month of April however, I have not been so dedicated to myself. I have slacked off in many healthy and loving aspects of my life and I have felt its toll. Today, May 2nd I showed up on my mat with your help and welcomed back in that love, joy and gratitude. My mantra for today was I choose graceful movement, and my mantra for the whole year is Graceful Acceptance, of myself, others, and daily life. You have helped me in many ways and although we do not know each other we both share a love of many things including: Austin, Barton Springs, Breakfast tacos, and loving ourselves and others. Namaste

You asked to let you know how this session helped - I started this video in a seated cross-legged position, and usually my right foot goes in front. Today, I was having pain in my right knee in that position, so I switched to left foot in front. At the end of the video, I absent-mindedly put my right foot in front - and then noticed that I had no knee pain in that position.

I'm not saying yoga is the cure-all, just giving my testimonial about where I was when I started, and where I was 20 minutes later, in a specific pose. I still have pain elsewhere, but I'm feeling much more fluid and moveable and less pain. Better, not perfect, is my goal.

Also, thanks for being a part of my self-care routine. I've gotten a lot out of having you as an instructor (via YouTube) over the last few years. I will often catch myself, when I'm just standing, parting attention to my feet and if I'm standing on all four corners of my feet. I am learning to accept myself and my limitations and meet myself there instead of judging myself because I can't do what someone else is doing. I'm not them! I'm me*, and this is where *I am. What I have learned from you goes far beyond the mat. Thank you.

Hi! I am really enjoying your video's and trying to find myself a play list with a few video's that work best for my body. And I think I heard you ask for ideas for new video's. So here is one! And some context! I have pain issues, fibromyalgie and have noticed that it helps if I do some exercises regularly during the day, with a max of 25 minutes (so far).

Today I am having a bad day but stubborn as I am, I tried your video of Total body yoga - Deep Core. So, yeah, did not get far with that :P But I do not give up! After that I did Yoga for hips & Lower back release, which did not do much but I could finish! So then I just finished with Yoga for flexibility, which turned out to be just what I needed!

And all of that searching made me think, maybe you could do a few daily routines, like the dedicate video's but cut them up. So in the morning you have a nice stretch like the Yoga for the feet and yoga for flexibility, around lunchtime something that takes a bit more power and warming you up and in the evening a cooling down and digestion, or a different order if that is better/healthier.

I've been feeling really negative, angry and scared lately. It's just a weird time for me, I've been buried in work, became annoyed with most of my friends. Been shutting myself out and feeling really sensitive. I always tended to be someone who liked people and talking to them but somehow lately I've been feeling like I can't connect and share with anyone because everyone is just wrapped up in their own drama and not interested in listening as much as talking. Everything just began feeling pointless to me. It's not like I stopped liking people or being kind to them, I just have been (secretly) nurturing this feeling of pointlessness and lack of hope. And all this negativity has been really weighing on me. Where I wanted to get with all of this is to the fact about yoga that made me come back to the mat today, the fact that it is a moment to be at the same time brutally and kindly honest with yourself. And that's why that moment in this practice when you compared it to "staring into a pond and looking at your own reflection" was so emotional for me. I felt so sad and scared while "looking" at my own reflection. I was faced with this abstract feeling that I can't connect with anyone, not even myself and that I'm so terrified of what the future holds. So terrified that it will be somehow disappointing, that I'l disappoint my self, that the world will feel disappointing. I am so scared of feeling pointless. But, after facing that, I feel a little, faint, spark of hope. I feel like I began (once again) healing, and that if I keep approaching this practice with honesty I may be able to, maybe, at some point, actually become the change I wanna see in the world instead of just feeling so negative and powerless. So thank you for giving me a path Adriene, it means more than you'll ever know.

"my child, listen carefreely
never stop running,
smiling, creating.
forever the fool, the weirdo, the baby.
this is your power and do not let them take it
do not let them erased it, diminished it, forget it.
this is your magic, forever and ever.
so never leave the land of awareness,
of dreams and beginnings,
of music and matter.
and before I rest, just promise me this:
do never grow up ,
it's a trap."

Love to everyone! Malu x
